newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - May 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - May 8.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
- A Shanghai company signed $1.0 billion contract with NEC of Japan to build an integrated circuit production line.
- A senior official of the Communist Party called for the streamlining of government departments to make them more efficient and cost effective.
- A court in Tibet sentenced former government advisor Qazha Qamba Chilai to six years in prison for plotting to split the country and leaking state secrets.
- Sales of lottery tickets were expected to raise 100 million yuan for construction in Tibet in 1997.
- Officials said China was to stricly limit the number of foreign beer enterprises allowed into the domestic market.
- Chinese electronics exports were expected to be worth 35 billion yuan a year by 2000.
China's table tennis players return home after scooping six of the seven titles at the world championships in England.
